original_title: Sri Lanka ruling party slams “baseless” rumours of Rajapaksa return
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), the island nation’s ruling party, never requested President Ranil Wickremesinghe to appoint SLPP leader Mahinda Rajapaksa prime minister, the party’s general secretary said.
SLPP legislator Sagara Kariyawasam told reporter on Monday May 15 that Rajapaksa would only take up such a position “with the blessings of the people” and not behind their back.
“This is a falsehood circulated by politicians who have run out of topics and are trying to cover their own political nakedness,” said Kariyawasam.

The Colombo rumour mill was on high gear Friday May 12 evening after security forces personnel were seen deployed in streets and suburbs. Speculation was rife that Rajapaksa was to be appointed prime minister in a surprise move.
It later transpired that the deployment was based on a false alarm.

“Mahinda Rajapaksa is the greatest leader this country has had since independence. He is a leader who ended a war that four presidents could not finish and stopped Sinhalese youth coming home in coffins and removed the cyanide capsule from the children in the north so they could study,” he said.

“To use his own language, he is not afraid to take power on behalf of the people and he can relinquish power for the people,” he added, insisting that the party would never have him installed in a position of power through the backdoor.
“If we do, it will definitely be with the blessings of the people and not behind their back,” he said. (Colombo/May15/2023)
